definition[0]: to telephone someone again, for example because they were not at home when you telephoned last time
example[1]: Can you ask John to call me back when he gets in?
definition[1]: to return to a place you went to earlier
example[2]: You could call back to collect her at noon.
definition[2]: to ask for something that you have lent or given to be paid or given back to you
example[3]: In conditions of liquidity shortage they will call back these loans.
definition[3]: to telephone someone again, usually because one of you was not in or was busy at the time of the first call
example[4]: No problem, I’ll call back later.
example[5]: Can you ask him to call me back when he gets in?
definition[4]: to visit a person or place again in order to do something
example[6]: I’ve got to do some shopping now. I’ll call back later for my order.
